alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Houlton, Millinocket, East Millinocket, Medway, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Amity, Haynesville, Sherman Station, Reed Plantation, southeastern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Cary Plantation, Littleton, Linneus, Oakfield, Mattawamkeag, Chester and New Limerick. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
